Blog.post: urlLink MeFi Swap So to those of you whom I haven't raved to in person yet, this is MeFi Swap, the MetaFilter Mix CD swapping program. Once a quarter, after you've signed up, you make up a Mix CD, burn 5 copies, and sent it to 5 people who are assigned to you. Likewise, different people will send you 5 different mix CDs. This looks like a great way to expand my musical horizons. Eli and I are already signed up, why aren't you!?!

If you've read any blogs recently, you'll have noticed that there is quite a bit of contention over the issue of widget legitimacy in the Apple world. A lot of people feel that the authors of Konfabulator should have been given the keys to the Apple castle for their work. urlLink Daring Fireball has recently posted a rather well done article on why apple has not really done anything wrong by not buying up Konfabulator as the basis of their new technology "Dashboard". Read it, and you will get a better picture of what is going on here. But urlLink some people still disagree, so I do what I always do whenever there is a contentious issue on a topic I am passionate about, drudge up an obscure metaphor. The thing that is most missed in reading the Daring Fireball article is that when you are creating a solution that Apple could create themselves, and doing it in a way that meshes perfectly in the Apple environment, you are treading on unstable ground. Konfabulator is a solution to a supposed hole in the Mac OS, and like the little Dutch boy, they stuck their finger in it. Its a good solution for now, it keeps the water in the dyke. But when the dyke-maker comes around to plug the hole with brick and mortar, the same brick and mortar he used to build the dyke, which is going to be the better solution. When you plug a hole that looks just like a dyke-makers job to the peasants, people will ask why we need dyke-makers to put these entrepreneurs out of business. But unfortunately, they don't have access to the dyke's plans; their patches may leak (in Konfabulator's case, quite a bit). The dyke-makers is going to do the repair right, so that the patch will hold; otherwise, they'd take on the amateur as a dyke-maker as well. Apple isn't trying to take customers away from Konfabulator, Apple is trying to plug the holes in the Mac OS. Konfabulator isn't a brick in the wall, it doesn't fit quite right, otherwise Apple would have slathered it over, and called it part of the dyke. And also, there is the issue with the mixup of terms at the Stevenote. Unfortunately, it is true that Steve did get the terminology wrong (gadget vs. widget), and forgot to mention the rest of webcore in his keynote (webcore minus java), I can't really blame him for that. First, while it is a developer conference, Steve is a showman, and as demonstrated elsewhere in the keynote, he doesn't like spitting out streams of three-letter-acronyms, which is basically what webcore is. Secondly, Steve is a big fan of sexy buzzwords, and widget is a much sexier word than gadget, any day of the week.
